title: How to Make Bacon Jam

steps.headline: Cook the bacon.
steps.description: Preheat oven to 350F. Use a broiling pan or line backing sheet with foil and bake the bacon until lightly browned and crispy. Cooking time may vary, approximately 15-20 minutes. For extra flavor, consider saving the bacon grease for sautéing. Allow bacon to cool and chop into ¾ inch pieces.

steps.headline: Sauté onion and garlic.
steps.description: Chop onion into ½ inch pieces and heat 2-4 tbs of bacon grease or preferred oil over medium-high heat. Add onions and stir frequently until nearly translucent, about 10 minutes. Add garlic and stir for another 1-2 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the remaining ingredients and bring the mixture to a boil.
steps.description: Once boiling, lower heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring every 10 minutes. Simmer 1 hour until liquids have reduced to a thick sauce. Let stand about 5 minutes to cool.

steps.headline: Blend the mixture in a food processor.
steps.description: The jam should be well combined but still chunky when finished.

steps.headline: Enjoy!
steps.description: You have successfully created bacon jam! After initial enjoyment, refrigerate in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks.
